result.execSummary:
The defendant James G Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $200 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James G Evans

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:04 p.m. Defendant James G Evans in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Oral motion by Atty Musolf for expungment of Case No. 04CM239. The court orders Case No 04CM239 expunged. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Based on the expungment of 04CM239 the Court orders Ct 1 amended to Misd Possession of THC.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson - requesting 20 days WCJ. Sentencing argument by Atty Musolf - requesting a fine on both counts. No statement by DE. Court orders: 20 days WCJ as to both counts concurrent- Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 6 months probation - Conditions: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
from Atty Musolf, Dated 5/11/2015 Re: Confirmation of Rescheduling P/S to 6/8/2015

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Kevin D. Musolf in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Musolf:  Obtaining transcript from our Court Reporter and should be received later this week due to Hemp issue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Kevin D. Musolf in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Musolf - request for transcript regarding the Hemp issue - 2004 transcript - still in the works.  DA states confirms Misd level offer extended.  Atty Musolf has not yet rec'd discovery.   Atty Musolf uncertain if offer would change if amended.  Counsel discuss State v. Hemp case law.  Court reviews minutes of 2004 case - clerk's minutes calls for expungement.  Successful discharge from DOC rec'd on 12/7/05.  2004 case would be a judicial conflict.  Atty Musolf would not be raising a judicial conflict.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 10:20 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:55 PM: Defendant James G Evans in court with attorney Kevin D. Musolf.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Per Atty Musolf:  Prior offense was granted expungement - State v. Hemp issue.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim to allow counsel time to explore Hemp issue.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 09:35 am.
